timeline.message: Validate state is queryable for committee information at slot
Add public method for getting queryable slot from target slot, clean up
Roll state forward when creating attestations
Roll state forward when pulling committee info via REST API
Move checkpoint state retrieval to CombinedChainDataClient
Cleanup - remove unused var, move comment

timeline.bodyText: This check means that if we have a span of time where no blocks are produced, we won't be able to query committee information for epochs ahead of the epoch after the latest block (from the REST API).  Is this right?
timeline.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: I think we now progress the best slot even if the slots are empty so this should work out ok.  Worth testing to be sure though.
replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: The slot we pull is the slot from the head block, not the latest slot processed.  I think what we probably want to do here is return an empty result if we're syncing, or return an error if the slot is from the future. 🤔
replies.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: Hmm, you'er right but we do track the actual best slot - updateBestBlock is called with the nodeSlot even if the slot was empty to ensure we treat It as a reorg if we later import blocks at those slots.  So if getBestSlot (or possibly a new method) returned chainHead.getSlot() we'd get the current slot regardless of any empty slots.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: This feels like a pretty expensive test to perform just to be defensive. I'm be tempted to omit it.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: yeah - I think I got a little carried away trying to figure out how to validate this.  probably not worth including.
replies.author: mbaxter
